intro: Aspidogyne tribouillieri, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has a climbing habit and produces small, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers emit a strong, sweet fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release the seeds.
